page.title: 01The Nercwys and Eryrys Area
page.content: This block is situated on rising land to the south of Mold. Part of the area falls in the old county of Flintshire, part in old Denbighshire, these now form the county of Clwyd. It includes parts of Nercwys, Treuddyn, Llanarmon and Llanferres Community Council areas. The north eastern part of the block is less hilly,to the south and west the land rises more steeply to about 1500ft, with rocky outcrops. The River Terrig and a stream flow in steep valleys from south to north in the east of the area. This area is also crossed by electricity pylons. The only settlement is the small village of Eryrys, the rest of the area is sparsely populated with houses and farms. Farming, dairy to the north east, sheep mainly on the hills, is the main activity. There are forests and there is a quarry in the area.
